citations.narrative:
Three dogs were observed to not have their identification numbers; the licensee reports some dogs have lost their tags
recently. Identification numbers are required and help track husbandry and health of dogs. If a dog loses a tag, try to find
it or affix a new official tag as required in the regulations.
***Correct by 4/25/2025

A written contingency plan/program was not available for inspection. Maintaining a documented contingency plan for
emergencies and natural disasters is required and helps a facility prepare for an emergency if it happens. Ensure to
document and maintain a written contingency plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing,
and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
***Correct by May 9, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.54 
   
Lost tags. 
Three dogs were observed to not have their identification numbers; the licensee reports some dogs have lost their tags 
recently. Identification numbers are required and help track husbandry and health of dogs. If a dog loses a tag, try to find 
it or affix a new official tag as required in the regulations.  
***Correct by 4/25/2025 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
A written contingency plan/program was not available for inspection. Maintaining a documented contingency plan for 
emergencies and natural disasters is required and helps a facility prepare for an emergency if it happens. Ensure to 
document and maintain a written contingency plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, 
and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.  
***Correct by May 9, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
